name: Gift Set
description:
Polycarp has 
    x
 of red and 
    y
 of blue candies. Using them, he wants
to make gift sets. Each gift set contains either 
    a
 red candies and

    b
 blue candies, or 
    a
 blue candies and 
    b
 red candies. Any
candy can belong to at most one gift set. Help Polycarp to find the largest
number of gift sets he can create. For example, if 
    x = 10
, 
    y = 12
,

    a = 5
, and 
    b = 2
, then Polycarp can make three gift sets: In the
first set there will be 
    5
 red candies and 
    2
 blue candies; In the
second set there will be 
    5
 blue candies and 
    2
 red candies; In the
third set will be 
    5
 blue candies and 
    2
 red candies. Note that in
this example there is one red candy that Polycarp does not use in any gift
set. Input The first line contains an integer 
    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t 
    ≤
    10^4
). Then 
    t
 test cases follow. Each test case consists of a single
string containing four integers 
    x
, 
    y
, 
    a
, and 
    b
 (
    1
    
    ≤ x, y, a, b 
    ≤ 10^9
). Output For each test case, output one number
— the maximum number of gift sets that Polycarp can make. Example Input 9 10
12 2 5 1 1 2 2 52 311 13 27 1000000000 1000000000 1 1 1000000000 1 1
1000000000 1 1000000000 1000000000 1 1 2 1 1 7 8 1 2 4 1 2 3 Output 3 0 4
1000000000 1 1 1 5 0
